Table stage: True. You can use the GET command to download files from the internal stage associated with a specific table.
User stage: True. The GET command allows downloading files from the user's internal stage.

questions.question_text: From which locations can data files be downloaded using the GET command? (Choose two.)
Which of the following commands sets the Virtual Warehouse for a session?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
c is correct

Selected Answer: D
D or C

Selected Answer: B
Both USE WAREHOUSE and SET WAREHOUSE commands serve the same purpose - they switch the current session to use the specified warehouse. They are completely interchangeable and functionally identical. The only difference is syntactic preference, similar to how both USE SCHEMA and SET SCHEMA are equivalent commands.

Example usage:

USE WAREHOUSE compute_wh
SET WAREHOUSE compute_wh
Choose whichever syntax you prefer - they will produce the same result.

Selected Answer: C
c.use warehouse <warehouse name>
C. USE WAREHOUSE <<warehouse name>>;
Why NOT B?
C. USE WAREHOUSE <<warehouse name>>;

Selected Answer: C
C.USE WAREHOUSE <<warehouse name>> . C is correct
USE WAREHOUSE <<warehouse name>> . C is correct
C. USE WAREHOUSE <<warehouse name>>;

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. According to snowflake docs, 

"A Snowflake session can only have one current warehouse at a time. The current warehouse for a session can be specified or changed at any time through the USE WAREHOUSE command."

Selected Answer: C
"Multi-cluster warehouses are best utilized for scaling resources to improve concurrency for users/queries. They are not as beneficial for improving the performance of slow-running queries or data loading. For these types of operations, resizing the warehouse provides more benefits."

Snowflake representative explained this here https://community.snowflake.com/s/question/0D50Z00009F8nPTSAZ/how-to-choose-the-right-virtual-warehouse-size-in-snowflake-for-your-workload
C should be correct

questions.question_text: How would you determine the size of the virtual warehouse used for a task?

choices.A: Root task may be executed concurrently (i.e. multiple instances), it is recommended to leave some margins in the execution window to avoid missing instances of execution
choices.D: Since task infrastructure is based on running the task body on schedule, it's recommended to configure the virtual warehouse for automatic concurrency handling using Multi-cluster warehouse (MCW) to match the task schedule
choices.B: Querying (SELECT) the size of the stream content would help determine the warehouse size. For example, if querying large stream content, use a larger warehouse size
choices.C: If using the stored procedure to execute multiple SQL statements, it's best to test run the stored procedure separately to size the compute resource first
